thread.section_title: Bayern Munich enter race for Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez – Metro
thread.title: Bayern Munich enter race for Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez
thread.title_full: Bayern Munich enter race for Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez

author: Coral Barry
title: Bayern Munich enter race for Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez
text:
Alexis Sanchez is considered Arsenal’s best player (Picture: Getty) Alexis Sanchez is reportedly wanted by Bayern Munich as the Germans look to dominate the Champions League next season.
Real Madrid ace hints he has HUGE problem with Arsenal star on social media Bayern smashed Arsenal 10-2 over two legs in the competition this season and now want to poach their biggest star.
Sanchez has so far refused to sign a new deal at the club with Arsenal more and more resigned to losing the Chilean at the end of the season.
Bayern have leapt to the front of the queue after Carlo Ancelotti ordered the club to go out and buy the missing piece of his side.
Sanchez is Arsenal’s top goalscorer this season (Picture: Getty) Sanchez is believed to be capable of firing Bayern back to the very top of European domination and challenge Barcelona and Real Madrid.
Sport claim Arsenal could sell Sanchez for as little as £35million with the attacker entering the final year of his contract.
Arsenal fixtures Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 Apr
Manchester City (N) FA Cup – Sun 23 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Manchester United (H) – Sat 6 May
Stoke (A) – Sat 13 May
More: Football £50m Prem star perfect for back three decides on summer move to Chelsea 
Is Eden Hazard already preparing for Real Madrid switch? 
N'Golo Kante reveals the team he was tempted to join over Leicester 
Bayern have reached the semi-finals of the Champions League five seasons in a row, but have won the competition just once in that time.
Real outcast James Rodriguez is another alternative should Bayern miss out on Sanchez.
Arsene Wenger will not want to lose Sanchez, but is open to rebuilding his squad without the goalscorer.
MORE: Robert Pires pinpoints where Arsenal’s season went wrong – and how things can be improved
